text: Ethiopian coffees are best known for their complexity with a pungent, winey quality and a distinct wildness in their acidity
These fine Mexican coffees are known for having light body and acidity, often with a nutty flavor, perhaps with chocolaty overtones
The high quality of Colombian coffee make it has a rich taste, is extremely aromatic, and has a mild flavor with a citrusy hint to it.
Peruvian coffee is smooth with its exciting flavor profile ranges from vanilla-nut sweetness to nutty, chocolatey notes and subtle tones of citrus.
